diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Bipolar I disorder with mixed features; invasive ductal carcinoma of the breast; lung cancer.
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient has a known history of bipolar disorder, which contributed to her nonadherence to treatment for newly diagnosed early-stage breast cancer. Her symptoms of depression, which included low motivation and hopelessness, were consistent with a major depressive episode typical of bipolar disorder. The presence of an invasive ductal carcinoma was confirmed through imaging and biopsy, distinguishing it from potential metastases originating from her lung cancer.
